transparency_code.name: Local Government Transparency Code 2015
transparency_code.requires: Quarterly publication of all spending over £500 (£250 for some councils). Includes supplier name, amount, date, category.

procurement_rules.threshold_high: Over £189,330 (goods/services) or £4,733,252 (works): full public procurement required
procurement_rules.split_payment_risk: Splitting contracts to stay below thresholds may breach Public Contracts Regulations 2015

companies_act_2006.directors: ss.154-156 — Every company must have at least one natural person as director at all times.
companies_act_2006.psc_register: s.790E — Persons of Significant Control must be registered. LLPs exempt under LLPA 2000 s.4(1).
companies_act_2006.filing_obligations: Annual confirmation statement and accounts required. Non-compliance triggers strike-off proceedings.

legal_framework.llp_exemption: LLPs (Limited Liability Partnerships) are exempt from PSC register requirements under LLPA 2000 s.4(1). Not a red flag.

analyses.name: Companies House Compliance
analyses.description: Checks each supplier against CH for active directors, PSC registration, and filing status. Payments during breach periods are flagged.

analyses.name: Likely Duplicate Payments
analyses.description: Groups transactions with same supplier, amount, and date proximity (<7 days). Excludes regular scheduled payments.

analyses.name: Split Payment Detection
analyses.description: Identifies multiple payments to the same supplier within short windows that individually fall below procurement thresholds but collectively exceed them.

analyses.name: Round Number Analysis
analyses.description: Flags payments at exact round amounts (e.g. £10,000.00). High proportion suggests estimated rather than invoiced payments.

analyses.name: Year-End Spending Spikes
analyses.description: Compares March spending to monthly average. Spikes indicate budget-clearing behaviour — spending to avoid returning unspent funds.

analyses.name: Cross-Council Price Comparison
analyses.description: Compares average payment amounts for shared suppliers across councils. Large gaps suggest inconsistent procurement or different contract terms.

red_flags.no_active_directors: Company has no natural person director — breaches CA 2006 ss.154-156. Council should not transact with non-compliant entities.
red_flags.no_psc_registered: No Person of Significant Control registered (unless LLP). Obscures beneficial ownership — potential money laundering risk.
red_flags.facing_strike_off: Company subject to compulsory or voluntary strike-off. Council risks paying an entity that may cease to exist.
red_flags.high_duplicate_rate: Multiple identical-amount payments to same supplier in short windows. May indicate invoice processing errors or fraud.
red_flags.split_payment_pattern: Payments structured to stay below procurement thresholds. May circumvent competitive tendering requirements.
red_flags.extreme_year_end_spike: March spending >5x monthly average suggests systematic budget-clearing rather than genuine service need.
red_flags.cross_council_price_gap: Same supplier charging vastly different prices to neighbouring councils indicates poor procurement coordination.

shared_suppliers.summary: 44 suppliers shared between Burnley/Hyndburn/Pendle. Combined spend on shared suppliers: Burnley £40.2M, Hyndburn £28.1M, Pendle undisclosed.

notable_shared.context: Outsourced services provider used by both Burnley (£36.7M) and Pendle (£16.7M). Burnley bringing contract in-house.
Burnley pays £56K avg per transaction vs Pendle £49 — a 115,237% price gap. Likely different service scopes.

comparative_metrics.worst_year_end_spike: Hyndburn (12.9x) — significantly worse than Burnley (5.7x) and Pendle.
comparative_metrics.highest_transaction_volume: Pendle (48,785 transactions) despite lowest total spend (£127M).

data_coverage.hyndburn: January 2017 – present, threshold £250 (longest dataset, lowest threshold)
